column4: is it possible to connect to the wpa encrypted wifi network in linux?
currently wpa support is very limited.. some cards will some just wont
what it could be, if it is a problem? it just doesnt connect, says it's "failed". there is no problem, if i remove the encryption. i am sure i am writing the password correct
are you using the generated key, (your router does this for you) you shouldn't have a problem w/that

yes, my router generates 4 keys, i copy the first into a textfield in this fancy plasma widget. but it stills asks me about "connection secrets", and even if i retype it (still right) it doenst connect ("connection failed")
the first question is for the wep key ... the second is your sudo password
it doesnt ask me about my root password, it the same window again, with "choose wep 64 or 128 bit" etc etc
and you have set a 64 bit or 128 bit in your router?
and it doesn't work ....  hmmm - what kind of wireless card do you have?
do you have linux-restricted-modules installed.. you may also need madwifi for that card's incryption to work
i've got both... and the card is working no problem with unencrypted network ... but i dont want to host free internet to for anyone ;/
that is understandable .. lemme go look at something real quick... I may come up with a solution
would unencrypted network with MAC filter be any close to "safe network"?
depends on where you live ... MAC filtering would work to keep people from using your network .. but people could still 'sniff' your unencrypted traffic
you may want to look at this thread http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=798485
